thread.title: 17 TV Roles That Almost Went to Other Actors (PHOTOS)
thread.title_full: 17 TV Roles That Almost Went to Other Actors (PHOTOS)

author: Jenny McGrath
title: 17 TV Roles That Almost Went to Other Actors (PHOTOS)
text:
NEXT Baywatch’s Hobie Buchannon 
David Hasselhoff nearly called Leonardo Dicaprio son! At 15, the eventual Oscar winner was all set to take the role of Hobie Buchannon, the Hoff’s Baywatch son. But David was worried having a teenage child on the series would make him look “older." 
So they went with Brandon Call, who is two years younger than The Revenant star, for season 1 and eventually recast the part with Jeremy Jackson, a full six years Leo’s junior. Baywatch’s Hobie Buchannon Advertisement 
David Hasselhoff nearly called Leonardo Dicaprio son! At 15, the eventual Oscar winner was all set to take the role of Hobie Buchannon, the Hoff’s Baywatch son. But David was worried having a teenage child on the series would make him look “older." 
So they went with Brandon Call, who is two years younger than The Revenant star, for season 1 and eventually recast the part with Jeremy Jackson, a full six years Leo’s junior. Sex and the City’s Carrie Bradshaw 
House star Lisa Edelstein had actually signed a contract to play Carrie in case Sarah Jessica Parker turned down the role. 
SJP didn’t, of course, and Lisa lost out on the part. She didn’t even watch the show, deeming the near-miss too painful to revisit. Sex and the City’s Carrie Bradshaw Advertisement 
House star Lisa Edelstein had actually signed a contract to play Carrie in case Sarah Jessica Parker turned down the role. 
SJP didn’t, of course, and Lisa lost out on the part. She didn’t even watch the show, deeming the near-miss too painful to revisit. Sex and the City’s Carrie Bradshaw 2.0 
Another Carrie contender? Body of Proof alum Dana Delany. Fearful of being typecast — having just finished Live Nude Girls — she decided not to take on the shoe-obsessed writer. Sex and the City’s Carrie Bradshaw 2.0 Advertisement 
Another Carrie contender? Body of Proof alum Dana Delany. Fearful of being typecast — having just finished Live Nude Girls — she decided not to take on the shoe-obsessed writer. The Office’s Michael Scott 
This is sideways! NBC wanted Paul Giamatti to head Dunder Mifflin's Scranton branch. He didn’t take the role, and Steve Carell became the bumbling boss. The Office’s Michael Scott Advertisement 
This is sideways! NBC wanted Paul Giamatti to head Dunder Mifflin's Scranton branch. He didn’t take the role, and Steve Carell became the bumbling boss. Will and Grace’s Grace Adler 
You may know her best as Judith on Two and a Half Men , but Marin Hinkle was nearly the neurotic bestie to Will on Will and Grace . 
Desperate Housewives star Nicollette Sheridan was another contender for the part, but Debra Messing won in the end. Will and Grace’s Grace Adler Advertisement 
You may know her best as Judith on Two and a Half Men , but Marin Hinkle was nearly the neurotic bestie to Will on Will and Grace . 
Desperate Housewives star Nicollette Sheridan was another contender for the part, but Debra Messing won in the end. Seinfeld’s Elaine Benes 
Can you see Rosie O’Donnell or Megan Mullally doing Elaine Benes’s little kicks? Both auditioned for Julia Louis-Dreyfus’s role on Seinfeld . Seinfeld’s Elaine Benes Advertisement 
Can you see Rosie O’Donnell or Megan Mullally doing Elaine Benes’s little kicks? Both auditioned for Julia Louis-Dreyfus’s role on Seinfeld . Seinfeld’s George Costanza 
Larry Miller was Jerry Seinfeld’s top pick to play George, but the role ultimately went to Jason Alexander. Seinfeld’s George Costanza Advertisement 
Larry Miller was Jerry Seinfeld’s top pick to play George, but the role ultimately went to Jason Alexander. Frasier’s Roz Doyle 
Before Peri Gilpin stepped into the role of Frasier Crane’s sassy producer, it belonged to Lisa Kudrow. She couldn’t make it work in rehearsals, but she ultimately went on to star in as Phoebe in Friends, which is a nice condolence prize. Frasier’s Roz Doyle Advertisement 
Before Peri Gilpin stepped into the role of Frasier Crane’s sassy producer, it belonged to Lisa Kudrow. She couldn’t make it work in rehearsals, but she ultimately went on to star in as Phoebe in Friends, which is a nice condolence prize. The entire ‘Friends’ cast 
Speaking of Friends , there was almost an entirely different crew sitting in Central Perk. 
The role of Monica was created for Janeane Garofalo. Both Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox were considered for each others’ roles. And could Matthew Perry be any more perfect for Chandler? Well, Two and Half Men ’s Jon Cryer passed on the part first. The entire ‘Friends’ cast Advertisement 
Speaking of Friends , there was almost an entirely different crew sitting in Central Perk. 
The role of Monica was created for Janeane Garofalo. Both Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox were considered for each others’ roles. And could Matthew Perry be any more perfect for Chandler? Well, Two and Half Men ’s Jon Cryer passed on the part first. Buffy the Vampire Slayer’s Buffy Summers 
Katie Holmes didn’t want to wait to finish high school, so she let Sarah Michelle Gellar stake the lead in Buffy the Vampire Slayer . Buffy the Vampire Slayer’s Buffy Summers Advertisement 
Katie Holmes didn’t want to wait to finish high school, so she let Sarah Michelle Gellar stake the lead in Buffy the Vampire Slayer . The Cosby Show’s Rudy Huxtable 
Steve Urkel as Rudy Huxtable? 
Jaleel White was once in consideration for Claire and Cliff’s youngest, who was originally a boy. When casting directors failed to find the perfect kid for the part, they started looking for girls and came across Keshia Knight Pulliam. The Cosby Show’s Rudy Huxtable Advertisement 
Steve Urkel as Rudy Huxtable? 
Jaleel White was once in consideration for Claire and Cliff’s youngest, who was originally a boy. When casting directors failed to find the perfect kid for the part, they started looking for girls and came across Keshia Knight Pulliam. Breaking Bad’s Walter White 
Before seeing Bryan Cranston on Breaking Bad , we couldn’t imagine the Malcolm in the Middle dad being so nasty. It’s kind of like trying to picture John Cusack or Matthew Broderick in the role — both actors were up for the chemistry-teacher-turned-meth-maker. Breaking Bad’s Walter White Advertisement 
Before seeing Bryan Cranston on Breaking Bad , we couldn’t imagine the Malcolm in the Middle dad being so nasty. It’s kind of like trying to picture John Cusack or Matthew Broderick in the role — both actors were up for the chemistry-teacher-turned-meth-maker. Arrested Development’s Tobias Fünke 
We almost blue ourselves when we found out Arrested Development creator Mitch Hurwitz wanted Andy Dick for a role in the show — most likely Tobias Funke. 
Due to commitments with another show, the comedian had to turn it down, and David Cross made the most beautiful Mrs. Featherbottom imaginable. Arrested Development’s Tobias Fünke Advertisement 
We almost blue ourselves when we found out Arrested Development creator Mitch Hurwitz wanted Andy Dick for a role in the show — most likely Tobias Funke. 
Due to commitments with another show, the comedian had to turn it down, and David Cross made the most beautiful Mrs. Featherbottom imaginable. Game of Thrones’s Jon Snow 
Oh what a tangled web the Westerosi weave. In a bizarre twist, Iwan Rheon made it to the final two for the casting of Jon Snow. 
Kit Harington famously won the role and Iwan was eventually chosen to play Ramsay Bolton, who’s beaten by Jon in the Battle of the Bastards. Game of Thrones’s Jon Snow Advertisement 
Oh what a tangled web the Westerosi weave. In a bizarre twist, Iwan Rheon made it to the final two for the casting of Jon Snow. 
Kit Harington famously won the role and Iwan was eventually chosen to play Ramsay Bolton, who’s beaten by Jon in the Battle of the Bastards. Gossip Girl’s Serena Van Der Woodsen 
Casting director David Rapaport was dying for celebrity daughter Rumer WIllis to play Gossip Girl ’s blondest and most dramatic character. 
But, Blake Lively slayed her audition and the rest was Upper East Side history. Gossip Girl’s Serena Van Der Woodsen Advertisement 
Casting director David Rapaport was dying for celebrity daughter Rumer WIllis to play Gossip Girl ’s blondest and most dramatic character. 
But, Blake Lively slayed her audition and the rest was Upper East Side history. Gossip Girl’s Blair Waldorf 
In another world, Rumer scored the role of Serena and Ashley Olsen was tapped as Blair Waldorf. 
The CW had the Olsen twin in mind as the UES queen bee when Gossip Girl was first getting off the ground. Gossip Girl’s Blair Waldorf Advertisement 
In another world, Rumer scored the role of Serena and Ashley Olsen was tapped as Blair Waldorf. 
The CW had the Olsen twin in mind as the UES queen bee when Gossip Girl was first getting off the ground. Scandal’s Olivia Pope 
Olivia Pope was almost Cookie-afied. Empire queen Taraji P. Henson tried out to play the D.C. fixer, but the part ultimately went to Kerry Washington. 
Taraji isn't bitter about the loss, saying of the experience, “Thank God Kerry got it … When I got [the script] I was like, ‘This is Kerry.’” Scandal’s Olivia Pope Advertisement 
Olivia Pope was almost Cookie-afied. Empire queen Taraji P. Henson tried out to play the D.C. fixer, but the part ultimately went to Kerry Washington. 
Taraji isn't bitter about the loss, saying of the experience, “Thank God Kerry got it … When I got [the script] I was like, ‘This is Kerry.’” NEXT Advertisement 
Sometimes actors inhabit their roles so completely, we can’t imagine anyone else ever embodying that character. But often their parts nearly went to someone else. 
Read on to find out who almost had lead roles in iconic TV shows — you'll never believe what could have been.
